intro: Meibomia caripensis var. triarticulata, commonly known as the three-jointed meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, with three leaflets that are usually elliptical in shape. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and they bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
